description: Numbers that are congruent to {0, 1, 2, 4, 5} mod 6.
comments: Complement of A016945. - _R. J. Mathar_, Feb 25 2008Nonnegative integers m such that floor(2*m^2/12) = 2*floor(m^2/12). See the Crossrefs field of A265187 for similar sequences. [_Bruno Berselli_, Dec 08 2015]
links: Index entries for linear recurrences with constant coefficients, signature (1, 0, 0, 0, 1, -1).
maple: for n from 0 to 200 do if n mod 6 <> 3 then printf(`%d,`,n) fi: od:
mathematica: Select[Range[0,100],Mod[#,6]!=3&] (* _Harvey P. Dale_, May 17 2011 *)LinearRecurrence[{1,0,0,0,1,-1},{0,1,2,4,5,6},90] (* _Harvey P. Dale_, Oct 05 2014 *)
author: _N. J. A. Sloane_.
extensions: More terms from _James A. Sellers_, Feb 19 2001
